name: Jo
tagline: Jo (0.5.0) is a thin (~16K) candy shell for making HTML5 apps. Jo works with: PhoneGap, Chrome, Safari, Opera, FireFox, iOS, Android, BlackBerry 10, Tizen, & Windows Phone 8+. Features include skinnable UI widgets, a clean event model and a light data layer.
body:
# Build web apps for 23 targets and counting

|                   | Chrome | Safari | FireFox | IE    | Built-In  | PhoneGap / Cordova |
|-------------------|--------|--------|---------|-------|-----------|--------------------|
| iOS 5+            | YES    | YES    | YES     |       |           | YES                |
| Android 4.1+      | YES    |        | YES     |       | YES       | YES                |
| Windows Phone 8+  |        |        |         | YES   |           | YES                |
| Mac OSX           | YES    | YES    | YES     |       |           |                    |
| Windows 8+        | YES    |        | YES     | YES   |           |                    |
| ChromeOS          | YES    |        |         |       |           |                    |
| Linux             | YES    |        | YES     |       |           |                    |
| BlackBerry 10     |        |        |         |       | YES       | YES                |
| FireFox OS        |        |        | YES     |       |           |                    |
| Tizen             |        |        |         |       | YES       |                    |

And any other platform which has high HTML5 standards (mostly CSS3 support).

# Jo + JavaScript + CSS3 = your app

Jo is a lightweight library for making modern web apps using JavaScript and CSS.

- single page apps
- fast downloads

  | File Type      | Raw Size | Minified | Gzipped  |
  | *.js           | ~135K    | ~65K     | **~16K** |
  | *.css          | ~22K     | ~16K     | **~4K**  |
  | (font glyphs)  | ~11K     |          | **~8K**  |
  |----------------|----------|----------|----------|
  | Total          |          |          | **~28K** |

- simple card/stack metaphore
- fast UI prototype to app development path
- develop locally with your favorite editor
- use your favorite build tools
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
